com.djrapitops.nmplayer.functionality

Class MusicPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.djrapitops.nmplayer.functionality.MusicPlayer

  • public class MusicPlayer
extends Object
    This class contains all the logic used to change the playback (sound that is coming out of the speakers). The class contains information about the current state of the player, as well as a PlaylistManager THIS CLASS SHOULD NOT BE INITIALIZED WITH CLASS CONSTRUCTOR, MusicPlayer IS A SINGLETON CLASS, use MusicPlayer.getInstance() instead.
    Author:
    Rsl1122
    See Also:
    PlaylistManager

    • Constructor Detail

      • MusicPlayer

        public MusicPlayer()
        Class constructor. Creates a new PlaylistManager and grabs the instance of MessageSender for easier access to sending messages.
        See Also:
        MessageSender

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
          throws IllegalStateException
        Method used to start the playback logic. Selects a playlist "all" that contains all the tracks in other playlists and the tracks folder. Sets the initial playing state to false.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If a javafx Application is has not been started yet.

      • selectPlaylist

        public void selectPlaylist(String playlistName)
                    throws IllegalStateException
        This method is used to change the playlist. PlaylistFileManager is used to load the playlist file, and TrackFileManager is used to translate the file contents into Track objects. Then the playlist inside the PlaylistManager will be set as the new List given by TrackFileManager. First track of the playlist will be selected if the currently playing track is not found.
        Parameters:
        playlistName - Name of the playlist
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If a javafx Application is has not been started yet.
        See Also:
        PlaylistFileManager, TrackFileManager, PlaylistManager, selectTrack

      • nextTrack

        public void nextTrack()
               throws IllegalStateException
        Used to move to the next track in the playlist. If currentTrack is null (Not initialized) nothing is done. Otherwise the playback is stopped, new Track selected, and then played.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If a javafx Application is has not been started yet.
        See Also:
        selectTrack

      • previousTrack

        public void previousTrack()
                   throws IllegalStateException
        Used to move to the previous track in the playlist. If currentTrack is null (Not initialized) nothing is done. Otherwise the playback is stopped, new Track selected, and then played.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If a javafx Application is has not been started yet.
        See Also:
        selectTrack

      • play

        public void play()
        Begins/Resumes the playback. If MusicPlayer is null (not initialized) nothing is done. Playing Message will be sent with MessageSender
        See Also:
        MessageSender

      • pause

        public void pause()
        Pauses the playback. If MusicPlayer is null (not initialized) nothing is done. Pause Message will be sent with MessageSender
        See Also:
        MessageSender

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the playback. If MusicPlayer is null (not initialized) nothing is done. Stop Message will be sent with MessageSender
        See Also:
        MessageSender

      • selectTrack

        public void selectTrack(Track track)
                 throws IllegalStateException
        Used to change the MediaPlayer object to play the Track. Creates a new MediaPlayer object with the filepath inside the Track object, and frees the resources associated with the old MediaPlayer object, if one exists. If the file specified by Track object doesn't exist a message will be sent with MessageSender. After successfully creating the new MediaPlayer object, the currentTrack information will be updated and a select message will be sent with MessageSender
        Parameters:
        track - Track to be played.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If a javafx Application is has not been started yet.
        See Also:
        MessageSender

      • selectTrack

        public void selectTrack(int i)
                 throws IllegalStateException
        Shortcut for selectTrack(playlist.selectTrack(i)).
        Parameters:
        i - Index of the track to select.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If JavaFx Application is not running.

      • addTrackToPlaylist

        public void addTrackToPlaylist(Track track)
                        throws IllegalStateException
        Adds a new Track object to the playlist in PlaylistManager. If the track given is null nothing is done. Otherwise the track is added to playlist in PlaylistManager, add message is sent with MessageSender and the new playlist is saved with PlaylistFileManager.
        Parameters:
        track - Track to add to the playlist.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If a javafx Application is has not been started yet.
        See Also:
        PlaylistManager, PlaylistFileManager, MessageSender

      • removeTrackFromPlaylist

        public void removeTrackFromPlaylist(Track track)
        Removes a track object from the current Playlist, and saves the change to the txt file.
        Parameters:
        track - Track to remove.

      • getCurrentTrackProgress

        public double getCurrentTrackProgress()
        Used to get the relative playtime/duration of the playback for the current track.
        Returns:
        a double from 0 to 1.0

      • setTrackPosition

        public void setTrackPosition(double d)
        Used to change the play position of the current track based on the relative duration given.
        Parameters:
        d - a double from 0 to 1.0

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(double d)
        Used to set the playback volume.
        Parameters:
        d - a double from 0 to 1.0

      • getVolume

        public double getVolume()
        Used to get the playback volume.
        Returns:
        a double from 0 to 1.0

      • getMediaPlayer

        public javafx.scene.media.MediaPlayer getMediaPlayer()
        Used to grab the MediaPlayer object that is currently handling the playback.
        Returns:
        MediaPlayer that has the current track playback capability.

      • isPlaying

        public boolean isPlaying()
        Tells whether or not the MusicPlayer has active playback going on.
        Returns:
        Is sound coming out of the speakers?

      • getPlaylist

        public List<Track> getPlaylist()
        Grab the currently used List of Tracks from PlaylistManager.
        Returns:
        list of tracks.
        See Also:
        PlaylistManager

      • getPlaylistManager

        public PlaylistManager getPlaylistManager()
        Used to get the PlaylistManager.
        Returns:
        Currently used playlistmanager.

      • getSelectedPlaylist

        public String getSelectedPlaylist()
        Used to get the name of the currently playing playlist.
        Returns:
        For example "All" or "TestPlaylist"

      • getCurrentTrack

        public Track getCurrentTrack()
        Used to get the currently playing Track object. Returns null if nothing is playing (isPlaying() false)
        Returns:
        currently playing Track object or null if nothing is playing.

      • setProgressBar

        public void setProgressBar(Updateable progressBar)
        Used to set the Updateable which .update() method will be called when the playback moves forward.
        Parameters:
        progressBar - An Object that implements Updateable

      • setEndOfMediaUpdate

        public void setEndOfMediaUpdate(Updateable updateable)
        Used to set the Updateable which .update method will be called when the playback ends at the end of file.
        Parameters:
        updateable - An Object that implements Updateable

      • getInstance

        public static MusicPlayer getInstance()
        Used to get the only instance of the MusicPlayer so that all of it's methods can be accessed easily.
        Returns:
        INSTANCE created in the static class MusicPlayerSingletonHolder
